resources.string: This app supports class activities for HCDD 340!
Please retry using correct email and password.

Human-Centered Design for Mobile Computing (HCDD 340) 
 
 This course will provide a hands-on introduction to different methods and tools for designing and developing mobile systems. 
 
 It will specifically focus on introducing different input modalities, discussing design guidelines, exploring sensing capabilities, and addressing accessibility requirements in mobile devices. 
 
 Toward this goal, the course will use the Android ecosystem to design and develop applications and interfaces. 
 
 The course will specifically follow a learning-by-doing approach through different class activities, assignments, and a final project. 
 
 Learning Objectives 
 
   ● Become familiar with processes and tools for mobile system design and development 
 
   ● Understand design requirements and guidelines for mobile applications 
 
   ● Translate design ideas into functional prototypes and applications 
 
   ● Develop and evaluate mobile systems
